etymologies: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin compilatio(n-), from compilare ‘to plunder’ (see compile)

definitions: the action or process of producing something, especially a list, book, or report, by assembling information collected from other sources

examples.text: great care has been taken in the compilation of this guidebook

shortDefinitions: action or process of producing something by assembling information collected from other sources

definitions: a thing, especially a book, record, or broadcast program, that is put together by assembling previously separate items

examples.text: there are thirty-three stories in this compilation

shortDefinitions: book put together by assembling previously separate items
